summary: This document is a series of emails from August 24-25, 2019, between attorney Gloria Allred and others, arranging last-minute travel for an Epstein victim to attend a hearing in New York. The emails discuss logistical details like flights from Las Vegas and obtaining identification for the victim, highlighting efforts to facilitate victim participation in legal proceedings.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Attorney representing an Epstein victim, actively coordinating travel arrangements for the victim to attend a hearing in New York.

persons.name: Diane
persons.context: Assistant to Gloria Allred who had previously sent the victim's driver's license information for travel.

persons.name: Olsen
persons.context: Recipient of the initial urgent email from Gloria Allred regarding the victim's travel needs.

connections.description: Attorney Allred is communicating with US Attorney Olsen regarding logistical arrangements for a victim to attend a hearing.
Diane is Allred's assistant, tasked with handling travel documentation for the victim.

events.title: Hearing in New York
events.description: A hearing related to the Epstein case that a victim wishes to attend, prompting urgent travel arrangements.

keyFacts: An Epstein victim, represented by Gloria Allred, sought to attend a hearing in New York on Tuesday, August 27, 2019.
The victim required financial assistance for last-minute travel from Las Vegas to New York, as she could not pay upfront and be reimbursed later.
Attorney Gloria Allred urgently contacted US Attorney Olsen and others over the weekend to arrange the victim's flight and obtain necessary identification details.
The emails demonstrate active efforts by a victim's attorney to ensure her client could participate in legal proceedings despite logistical and financial hurdles.
